cell.ref: King of France to his parliament
Dinner at Cadel's on Gibbon's birth day & day of publication, Sheffield, Fullarton, Reynolds, Gillies, Kippis
R. P. Arden master of the rolls
Lord Kenyon lord chief justice of the king's bench
Sir A. Macdonald attorney general; sir J. Scott, solicitor
Dispute between Pitt & Thurlow, respecting Arden's appointment to the rolls, terminated in favour of the former.
E. Bearcroft chief justice of Chester; F. Burton a Welch judge, v. D. B
Earl of Chatham first lord of Admiralty
Go to the House of Commons
Right of the P. of W. asserted by Fox
Question of right deprecated by the dukes of York & Gloucester. Thurlow ambiguous
Right of Parliament to appoint a regency decided, 267 to 203. Fox censures Thurlow
Limitations on the regent voted 227 to 154
Power of the Queen voted, 229 to 165
Prince of Wales refuses to dance with Lenox
Difference of Necker & the King: he proposes to resign
King of France submits to the National Assembly

ref.seg: Dine with the Revolutionists: see Price, Kippis, Rees, Towers, Lindsey, Disney, Belcham, Forsaith, Morgans, Listers, S. Rogers & B. Wits. Present, earl Stanhope, //Beaufoy, H. Tooke & count Zenobio . see B. Hollis, Jennings, Lofft & Robinson

cell.ref: Ml Mu charged his son £2000 for 3 Lettres de Ct. Dr Price disapproves of Mu's bank
Dine with the Anti-tests: Fox, Beaufoy, Hoghton, Sawbridge Adair, Watson, Heywood, B. Hollis, Shore, Geddes, Vaughan, Fell, Stone, Wodhul, Listers
Titles of nobility abolished by the national assembly
D'Orleans & Mirabeau accused by the Châtelet to the National Assembly
Family Compact adopted by the National Assembly
Motion for the removal of ministers rejected 403 \ 340

ref.seg: Revolution Society. Price in the chair. Motion by Tooke against nobility: pro. Cooper, Sharpe, Favel: con. Rees, Watson, Towers, Perry, Price—Garrow

cell.ref: P. of W. negotiated yesterday a loan of £300,000 in Holland, Portland & Fitzw. Securities
Burke swears himself 60, to disqualify for election committees
Hear dr Priestley's funeral sermon for dr Price
Misunderstanding of Fox & Burke. House of Commons

Scott, a believer in spiritual intercourses lends Paine £40, to aid the publication of his pamphlet, suspended for want of money. (Lewis.) H. Tooke states to the Const. Soc.Paine's offer of £300. (B. Hollis.)
Flight of the king of France
Crown & Anchor: Rous & Merry: B. Hollis, Shore, Barbauld, Disney, Jennings, Rees, Morgan, Lindsey, Lewis

ref.seg: Dine at the London Tavern, With Paine, Pethion, Horne Tooke, Priestley, Kippis, Rees, B. Hollis, Listers, Morgans

cell.ref: Slave trade: leave the chair 234 to 87—gradually 193 to 125—230 to 85
Hear the resumed debate on the abolition of the slave trade
Libel Bill, second reading in the lords 57 to 32
Prosecution of P. J. debated this week
house of commons, suspension of h. c
House of Commons, Fox on the war; Weld, Mac, Perry, P Stuart, Fenwick, Marsh; R Adair, Tierney & O Brien
Hustings; Tooke, col Barry, Blake, White, Ward, F Vaughan, Richter, &c
House of Cs, Austrian Subsidy; Jeffries, Tierney, O'Brien, Perry{,} Gordon, Hay, Moir, G Moore, Wilson, Ritson, Fenwic & Taylor Lancastrian
House of Commons; Grey, Burdet, Brogden, O'Brien, Mackintosh, Perry, Gordon, Banks, & Dangerfield
Union debated: voted in the Irish Commons, majority, one
Funeral at Old Windsor; adv. Warrington, Kimberley & miss Hall

ref.seg: Proclamation of Peace, &, w. M J & children, illuminations
Hustings, C G, w. M J; adv. Fell
Mass for D'Enghien, w. M J

cell.ref: Slave Trade condemned, H. of C., 124 to 49
Melville Impeachment, 195 to 272: Criminal Prosecution, 238 to 229
Royal Family of Portugal for Brazil

ref.seg: Requests, v. Darton, w. T T
walk to Piccadilly, w T T; adv. Newtons
wlk to Piccadilly, w. M J

cell.ref: Examination of sir R P; adv. Cullen, Rivington, Bensley, Letterman, Bingham, Hannam, Phipps, White & Watkinson
Regent to R H S Perceval
Battle of Barrosa. Massena retreats from Santarem
Mutiny Act passed, with a clause giving a discretionary power to courts martial
D. of Gloucester Chancellor of Uni. of C
Duke of York Commander in Chief
Ministry condemned by H of C, 174 to 170
Court of Aldermen; adv. Goodbehere, Reeves, Thos Bell & Line
Convention for the Surrender of Paris
Brutus played Nov. 19, 20, 24: Brutus, & Jaffier, announced (Nov. 22) for 27, interdicted
Duel, H Grattan & Earl of Clare
abdication of the King of Sardinia
Scarlet’s Poor Laws’ Bill, Second Reading
Reply of Spain to the Holy Allies
Letter sent, L B to S T S
Speech of Louis 18: war with Spain
S T S to L Byron
Catholic Bill rejected by Lords, 178 to 130
Sir Walter Scot avows the Scotch Novels
London University, First Stone; adv. Gent, R. Taylor , female E Ts & Coates

ref.seg: Hear Fox, Finsbury, w. Hodgetses & Twamley

cell.ref: Accident at C G Theatre, Gas
D’Orleans declared K of ye French
Plan of Parliamty Reform opened, debate 7 days
Numbers for England & Wales to continue, 299 to 291
Reform Bill passes the Commons, 345 to 236
E Grey, Dinner w L Mayor
Reform Bill, Secd Reading, Lds 184 to 175
Irish Tithe Bill rejd, Lds, 189 to 122.)
appropriation, Church Revenues, Ireland, 4 days’ debate, 322 to 289
H of Commons, Irish Poor Laws; O’Connel, &c
Divide Irish Appropriation Bill, 3 days’ debate, 282 to 319. July 21, 22, 23
counsel to be heard on Corporation Bill, Lords
Evidence admitted on Corporation Bill, Lds, 124 to 54
appropriation clauses, Irish Church Bill, negatived, Lords, 138 to 41
Orange Societies proscribed, D C, nc
Irish Corporation Bill, to proceed, after 2nd reading, 307 to 243
